data.title: Fairfield University
data.meta_description: Five student teams make their business pitch live and compete for seed funding. Be there when they make the deal!
data.text:
He is currently an adviser to Zircon, a US public company in the area of sensory consumer products. He is also an adviser and member of the Supervisory Board of Solayer, an optical equipment company based in Frankfurt, Germany. He has been an adviser to AMEC, a semiconductor equipment company, based in Shanghai, China since 2008. The Bronson Group, LLC. participates as an adviser and investor in various venture capital backed activities in the technology area.

Joe currently serves on the board of PDF Solutions, Inc. a US public company listed on NASDAQ as the lead independent director. Joe is a certified public accountant and holds a Bachelor of Science degree in accounting from Fairfield University and a Master of Business Administration from the University of Connecticut.

The firm has made over 150 investments since 2012, realizing 72 exits and 9 IPOs to date. His team provides business consultation and go to market support services to help portfolio companies validate product market fit, establish, and execute their scaling strategies.

In addition to his portfolio development work, Chris leads investment and board engagements in several DT Capital portfolio companies including Calamu (a cybersecurity company) and Ibex (The most widely deployed AI powered platform for Digital Pathology.) Chris holds a BS in Marketing and Information Systems from Fairfield University, an MBA in Finance from the University of Connecticut, is a graduate from the General Management Program from the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania.

Beyond her role at COMPEL CEOs, Jamie is the co-founder of Growing Minds Academy, an early childhood education academy committed to fostering a nurturing environment for young minds to flourish. Jamie's journey into entrepreneurship was sparked during her participation as one of the first contestants in the Fairfield University Business Plan Competition. Her commitment to innovation is exemplified by her venture into the food puree arena, where she is embarking on a new business journey with a trusted partner.

Mindee has devoted her career to the growth and betterment of Barnum Financial Group. Throughout her 30-year career Mindee has been a major contributor to Barnum’s overall growth and success. Presently, Mindee Blanco is the Chief Operating Officer focused on building and leading strategic initiatives, business development initiatives, firm financials, mergers & acquisitions, and overseeing the firm’s physical infrastructure. Most recently Mindee created the firms first ever team devoted to creating, centralizing, and communicating business and financial models through the firm.

In 2020, Mindee co-created Barnum’s Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging council. Mindee and Paul started the Foundation for Life, Inc., a 501(c)(3) organization. In addition, Mindee serves on the Board of Directors of Near and Far Aid Association.

Tom is Chief Executive Officer of Delticus Group. He is the former Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of ITT Inc., a $3 billion global manufacturer of engineered solutions for the Industrial, Energy, and Transportation markets.

He is a proven strategic finance leader who executed two successful public company spinoffs and several strategic acquisitions while generating significant value for shareholders. At ITT, Tom was instrumental in establishing ITT as a global, multi-industrial company that consistently delivered strong financial results. In addition to his CFO responsibilities, Tom effectively led ITT’s Strategic Planning & Corporate Development function.

He is the President of The Cancer Couch Foundation, Treasurer of RYASAP (Regional Youth and Social Action Partnership) and a Member of the Deloitte CFO Advisory Council. In 2019 and 2020, Tom was named to the Institutional Investor All-America Executive Team as Best CFO. He holds an MBA in finance and international business from New York University, where he graduated with distinction, and a BS in accounting from Fairfield University.
